body.description: Mellow's Rocky Base C is constructed with 100% steel and patented heavy duty steel slats to support both you and your mattress. Its clean, simple edges create a modern design, perfect for minimalists. To save you as much space as possible, we included 11-inch under-bed clearance for storing your odd bits and ends. What's more, this bed requires no additional tools, will be easily assembled within minutes and comes with a 5-year manufacturer's warranty. Product Dimensions: Twin: 75" x 39" x 14" Twin XL: 80” x 39” x 14” Full: 75" x 54" x 14" Queen: 80" x 60" x 14" King: 80" x 76" x 14" California King: 84" x 72" x 14"

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Mellow’s Rocky bed base series feature clean, simple edges paired with remarkable strength and durability. Simple yet bold, Rocky C is a sturdy platform bed with a modern design and superior mattress support system. Rocky C is constructed with patented wide steel slats and anchored down with heavy duty steel legs. The middle leg at the side of the bed was removed for your comfort. Rest well and start your day on the right, unhurt foot.

Highlights Patented Wide Steel Slats Made with 100% steel, our patented wide slats help prevent the mattress from sagging and enhance the mattress’ lifespan. Heavy Duty Steel Base We’ve placed 2.4 inch heavy duty steel legs to soundly support any type of mattress and provide a reliable anchor for attaching a separate headboard. Under Bed Storage We’ve left 11 inches of under bed clearance for storing odd bits and ends to help you make the most of your space and keep your bedroom organized.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of the best purchases I’ve ever made
reviews.reviewText: What a fantastic product! First of all, it’s very reasonably priced for a california king platform bed frame, which is very hard to find. It shipped in a timely manner. It was extremely easy to put together! The tools included were EXCELLENT - two regular Allen wrenches, AND a ratcheting Allen wrench! Which was fantastic! I used it for the entire assembly, which took maybe 30 minutes by myself.The entire thing is solid metal, it’s VERY sturdy.Then they have all the relevant parts lined with foam so there’s ZERO, absolutely NO squeaking, grinding, nothing, no noise whatsoever. I have literally never in my life had a bed frame that didn’t at least creak a little, until this one. It’s such a simple thing and yet I’ve never seen another bed frame, for this kind of low price, have that feature.The slats are close together so you don’t have to worry about your fancy mattress warranty being voided, or sagging, by lacking support. They’re also wide, and come on a roll of Velcro, so that they don’t move once they’re in place, and which also keeps them silent. The manufacturing is perfect - the velcro roll with the slats is precisely the same size as the corresponding strip on the sides of the frame, so if you line it up correctly at one end, it’s perfect on the other end. AND, two rows of slats have non-slip adhesive, so that once your mattress is in place, it won’t slide anywhere. Again - something that is so simple, yet I have never seen such a genius feature on another bed frame.I am so beyond impressed with this bed frame. It’s high quality in materials, in manufacturing, and in design. And within the design, they made it look great, with smooth flawless material, and easy to assemble. Everything is perfectly labeled, the instructions were clear and complete, and the small parts and tools come in a vac-packed kit so that nothing can go missing in transit or be left out during packing.Some other features include plastic feet so that it doesn’t scratch delicate floors, but will also slide over carpet nicely if you need to move it; and pre-drilled holes in the headboard-end of the frame to attach a headboard if you want to.This simply has everything:-great price-great design-great craftsmanshipThey thought of everything and kept the price reasonable. I can’t think of a single thing I’d change or add. I’m so glad I picked this frame.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Totally satisfied in Virginia! A+ Frame!
reviews.reviewText: Excellent frame! My wife and I took about 30 minutes to put this together and cut down/throw away all the cardboard boxes, plastic wrap, and foam at approx 2 am in the morning. We were tired after a long day and this is what we did last. This frame is not made cheap. It is far more sturdy then I expected. I'm a 250 lb man and my wife is about 150 lbs and this frame can hold our bed and us with ease. We ordered the queen size because our previous King was more bed than we needed. The key to successfully putting this together is to not tighten down any screw until the end. Hand tighten them all to about 1/8" from touching their heads on the metal rail. You will need to push and pull a bit to get some of the final holes lined up but as long as one of you has some muscle it shouldn't be too difficult. My wife isn't mechanically inclined but I am very mechanical. We had a breeze putting this together. Btw, check the velcro before assembling the pieces so that none of it falls off during assembly. We had a few pieces of velcro on the side rails that was still VERY tacky but was loose. We just lined up the velcro on its rail and pressed it down hard and ran our fingers up and down the rail a few times to make sure the velcro was tight to the rail this time. Fixed the velcro very easy. The hardware and tools that come with this frame are very few. I was surprised at how easy it was all to put together. The entire assembly comes with 15 bolts and 2 wing nuts and 2 matching Allen wrenches. By the time you get the outer assembly together, half the hardware is gone because each inside corner takes 2 of the bolts. Every rail was made very well. There was some light scratches here and there and I could see a little bare metal on the outside corners but it's a black frame that will never be seen once the outer wooden frame (found, built and/or sold separately) is placed around the frame anyhow. Also, note that the metal slats have plastic end caps that may need to be pushed in a little to be tight. If a cap is sticking out a little bit then the slat won't fit into the frame. I used my palm to tap them down tight and then the slats fit snuggly. Position your slats centered or the gap on each end won't be even and that will also change the load of the weight on the slats. Truly though this frame is so well built that an inch here or there is very unlikely to make a difference. Included are our pictures because we wanted to help others make an informed decision. The single issue we have with this frame is that there is no recess on the edges of the frame for your box spring or mattress to sit inside so the mattress or boxspring could slide around a bit. We knew this going into this purchase and we already knew we were going to build a wooden frame (with drawers built into the bottom under the frame) on the outside of this frame that would provide that lip we wanted. The wooden frame will look sharp and provides under frame storage. Just ordered a headboard for this and it will be delivered in about a week. I'll try to get back to this review and update pics. God Bless.

I needed this bedframe to replace my old bed until I move out to a bigger place in the next year, so obviously I was looking for a cheap option because I'm not going to keep it for long. But I'm actually very impressed with the quality and sturdiness, especially for how cheap this was. I almost expected it to be wobbly and squeaky, you know. But it's the complete opposite. I'm so happy with this bed.Pros: -SUPER EASY to assemble! Took less than 15 minutes for two people and we went slowly-Sturdy-Zero squeaks-It still folds in the middle after assembling it, which makes it so easy to turn around in a narrow room. It probably doesn't fold completely but it's enough to make it narrower when needed during transport-Nice minimalist design that doesn't take unnecessary extra space in a small bedroom-The cute little drive ratchet tool they give you is a plus-Very light and easy to move aroundCons:-None that I can think of

reviews.reviewTitle: Would recommend, would buy again, all furniture should be this easy!
reviews.reviewText: I came home from a closing shift and it only took me an hour to assemble, including making my bed and rejigging the storage boxes underneath.It has a matte white finish with one glorious sized bolt for all sixteen assembly points. No more fishing through overly complicated hardware and wordless instructions. I hate furniture assembly and I barely read the paperwork before easily assembling this unit.The steel slats are solid and robust, and there are nonslip tape strips preinstalled. You just need to remove the paper.The measured space beneath the bed is accurate as exactly 12". I'd want 14 but that's a minor gripe.

Great overall design. Bought this to replace an old frame for a king sleigh bed that was not supporting the box springs and was sagging. Measured the interior space in the sleigh to make sure there was enough room and placed this frame inside the sleigh directly on the floor. A bed-in-a-bed of sorts. Got rid of the box springs and layed the mattress directly on this new frame. Solid! Super easy to setup.

This is the best priced model of this frame-style that I have found anywhere. Really easy to put together and the slats are sturdy. The white is a beautiful matte finish and it could be easily mistaken for a wood frame - doesn't have that cheap metal look. No squeaking or anything and sits high enough that you have room for under-bed storage. Love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Size for a small space
reviews.reviewText: Very sturdy frame. Fit our ENDY TWIN XL mattress perfectly. Ample storage underneath for wheeled storage. Had an issue with delivery. Vendor was very responsive and resolved my issue. Would by from again.
